results.content:
I learned a lot about the importance of bandwidth and backup files. I am starting a web hosting company soon, so this was very helpful from Diego. A very smart young man.

Only thing I would say is that some newbies like myself may need an intro to the terms and jargon that websters use to help me follow along better. Other than that, excellent job Diego!

results.content: I felt like the information in the sections was very brief and somewhat disorganized.  I took this course because I am interested in getting more into web design and it sounded like it would have information that would be useful.  Some of the information presented was ok, but a lot of it was just kind of skimmed over.  I would have liked to see more development of the sections - now I have many more questions that when I began.  It's good that the lectures gave me more ideas for what I need to look into, but it would have been nice to get that information here.

results.content: Everything you need to know about web hosting! Thank you very much!
results.content_html: Everything you need to know about web hosting! Thank you very much!

results.content: I thought that the course was well designed and opened my eyes to many cool features and resources about building websites that I was unaware of.  The class is short and does not cover everything you need to know, but it is a great introductory course!  Thank you!
results.content_html: I thought that the course was well designed and opened my eyes to many cool features and resources about building websites that I was unaware of. The class is short and does not cover everything you need to know, but it is a great introductory course! Thank you!

results.content: Teaches the fundamentals of setting up a shared hosting account but misses the nameservers part. Also, I would not recommend anyone to buy from godaddy or hostgator(EIG - avoid all) since they are extremely poor now. Hostgator was good before but now its sold to EIG which has a good reputation for downtime and upselling. For domains, I recommend namecheap and for hosting you better check the sticky threads from http://www.webhostingtalk.com/forumdisplay.php?s=9b30e3e6052647dc770fd126d7bca8b4&f=4

results.content: It was good at showing the necessary basics but a little more on what other functions are available would be good. It also needs a way to download the hosting sites document page and maybe a document with the steps outlined that he goes over. A 1, 2, 3, 4 kind of document on starting and protecting a domain on a hosting site. This content was very disjointed information. Only an overview. But I still learned from each section something useful.

results.content:
Hi ,

I was not aware of web hosting even after being software engineer in IT industry last 6 years,But this video made me to learn step by step and more cleared way, Now I know how to create software using java,spring,jsp and primeface but lagging with host part..Now I can do easily with help of this course.

Thanks a lot, I spent money for understanding the hosting but not cleared how to host just given highlight but this video made my day!!!.
